document.masterDocTitle: Phytoseiid mites (Acari: Phytoseiidae) from Argentina, with description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Phytoseiid mites (Acari: Phytoseiidae) from Argentina, with description of a new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
FEMALE. (
3 specimens
measured)

Dorsal shield 404 ( 383–425 ) long and 338 ( 325–350 ) wide; j 1 33 ( 33–34 ), j 3 43 ( 40–45 ), j 4 5 ( 4–5 ), j 5 4 , j 6 5 ( 5–6 ), J 5 4 ( 3–5 ), z 2 27 ( 27–28 ), z 4 23 ( 22–24 ), z 5 4 ( 4–5 ), Z 1 5 ( 5–6 ), Z 4 105 ( 100–110 ), Z 5 93 ( 92–95 ), s 4 105 ( 101–110 ), S 2 7 ( 6–7 ), S 4 6 ( 6–7 ), S 5 8 ( 7–8 ), r 3 23 ( 21–25 ), R 1 9 ( 8–10 ); distances between st 1 -st 3 64 ( 63–65 ), st 2 -st 2 83 and st 5 -st 5 104 ( 98–110 ); ventri-anal shield 120 ( 110–130 ) long, 118 ( 113–120 ) wide at level of ZV 2 and 85 ( 80–90 ) wide at level of anus; JV 5 75 ( 73–76 ); movable cheliceral digit 39 long, with 2 teeth; fixed cheliceral digit 43 long, with 15 teeth; calyx of spermatheca 19 ( 18–20 ) long; Sge
I 32
, Sge
II 33
, Sge
III 34
( 33–36 ), Sti
III 29
( 28–30 ), Sge
IV 74
( 73–75 ), Sti
IV 56
( 54–58 ), St
IV 65
( 61–68 ). Chaetotaxy: genu II 2 , 2/ 0-2 /0, 1; genu III 1 , 2/ 1-2 /0, 1.

MALE. (
1 specimen
measured)

Dorsal shield 313 long and 138 wide; j 1 25 , j 3 50 , j 4 4 , j 5 4 , j 6 4 , J 5 4 , z 2 20 , z 4 18 , z 5 4 , Z 1 5 , Z 4 85 , Z 5 80 , s 4 76 , S 2 6 , S 4 5 , S 5 6 , r 3 23 , R 1 9 ; ventri-anal shield 143 long and 165 wide at the anterior corners, JV 5 49 ; Sge
I 20
, Sge
II 23
, Sge
III 20
, Sti
III 23
, Sge
IV 50
, Sti
IV 38
, St
IV 55
.

Specimens examined. Salta : San Ramón de la Nueva Orán – Ingenio Lote Verona (
23 ° 9 ' 45.9 ''S
,
56 ° 19 ' 41.6 ''W
),
10 -V- 2007
, on unidentified plant ( 1 Ψ). Tucumán : San Miguel de Tucumán – Horcomolle (
26 ° 47 ' 36.1 ''S
,
65 ° 19 ' 0.1 ''W
),
15 -V- 2007
, on
Citrus reticulata
( 3 Ψ, 2 ɗ).
Previous records. Brazil , Colombia , Ecuador and Peru (Guanilo et al . in press ).

Remarks. Females collected in this study agree with the measurements given in the original description. According with
Chant & McMurtry ( 2005 a)
,
P . neotropicus
belongs to belizensis species group by having no macroseta on genu I. However, the specimens examined in this study have a distinct macroseta on genu I.

Amblyseius ( Amblyseius ) peltatus
Van der Merwe 1968 : 119 (synonymy by
Tseng 1983
).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Amblyseius parapeltatus
Wu & Chou 1981
: 274
(synonymy by
Tseng 1983
).

Proprioseiopsis ovatus ,
Moraes et al . 1986
: 121
; 2004 : 184 ; 2007 : 19 ;
Chant & McMurtry 2005 a
: 15
; 2007 : 89 ; Guanilo et al . in press .

subSubSection.paragraph:
FEMALE. (
2 specimens
measured)

Specimens examined. Corrientes : Curuzú Cuatiá – Ex Ruta 14 (
29 ° 46 ' 34.6 ''S
,
58 ° 4 ' 42.8 ''W
),
6 -V- 2007
, on
Solanum americanum
( 1 Ψ); Curuzú Cuatiá – Ruta 14 (
29 ° 47 ' 57 ''S
,
58 ° 4 ' 42.9 ''W
),
6 -V- 2007
, on
Solanum
sp 2 . ( 1 Ψ, 1 immature). Salta : San Ramón de la Nueva Orán – Río Blanco (
22 ° 57 ' 53.7 ''S
,
64 ° 21 ' 51.3 ''W
),
10 - V- 2007
, on
Nicotiana tabacum
( 1 Ψ).

Remarks. Measurements of females collected in this study generally agree with those mentioned by
Moraes & McMurtry ( 1983 )
for the holotype , except that their seta j 3 and Sge IV are approximately 1.3 times longer. We consider that the specimens identified by
Furtado et al . ( 2007 )
as
P . cannaensis (Muma)
are actually
P . ovatus
.
